The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with intricate patterns that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scelochilus aureus is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
